5866185C465340B6801D978C48BFF7B9.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific vocabulary accurately within informational writing.

0AA5399C34314879BD4844A9D63803C3.description: Use newly acquired domain-specific words and phrases accurately.

E695B79AA90E482BB258AD9E1C3E9F08.description: Use newly acquired conversational and general academic words and phrases accurately.

5E5444CD33E74878BF6F77E01F163C2F.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that
signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night, we went looking for them).

352CEDDC3DDC4B398E44DCBC818B5382.description: Identify and sort shades of meaning words from general to specific or lesser to specific.

C8C59204071C425C8517FE953C182FDA.description: Use newly acquired words in real-life context.

3BC5FDC0C5464FD5B91431FCF779F241.description: Distinguish literal from non-literal meanings of words and phrases in context.

36B2006DF2564CDA8166702B5F36EC6B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
a. Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).
b. Identify real-life connections between words and their uses (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).
c. Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected,
heard, and wondered).

A330111844684F678A0C57295AB93EC3.description: Use a glossary or dictionary to determine the meaning of a word.

F62FF1F86FB24ABA9312A8346CB08A65.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root.

46CA094E54CB435AAF9FA683ADC3B3F0.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word.

925F8886C1824384A4F58F5B397FA5E4.description: Use sentence context as a clue to the meaning of a new word, phrase, or multiple meaning word.

AD6581D0182440B7814FA5FF78064353.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable,
comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).
b. Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).
c. Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrases.
d. Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases

C7F6BA8F2C1A4584825660B5E4CDC5CF.description: Choose words and phrases for appropriate effect (e.g., to inform) within writing.

6C2014E18CAB4E68B81E9B3E903AAF9D.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Choose words and phrases for effect.
b. Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written Standard English.

3C16F4EC935F41E28D8D6463A4DE9DC8.description: Capitalize dates, name of people, holidays, product names, and geographic names.

5D052EC507534D2E90DA333C355E393E.description:
Use conventional spelling (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries) and spelling patterns (e.g., word families, syllable patterns, ending
rules) in writing high frequency and/or previously learned words.

B2FB427BBC6244FE947A2AFFA49A03A5.description: Use commas accurately in addresses or dialogue within writing.

63F295C4CFEE4AD197CD989DDAA48C8C.description: Capitalize words in holidays, product names, geographic names, and appropriate words in a title.

7C76C32EF642463081993A04000A1499.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Capitalize appropriate words in titles.
b. Use commas in addresses.
c. Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.
d. Form and use possessives.

191DCD6E4E3146D0A1151C7F99BD3F10.description: Use simple and compound sentences in informative/explanatory writing.

AD4489F02D004446AC9AD3FEB6EBF72B.description: Write sentences using correct subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.

18A0C0B40CCF4CCCB7CA9875A78DA483.description:
Write sentences using nouns (regular, irregular, abstract), verbs (regular, irregular, simple tenses), and adjectives and/or
adverbs.

FFA4E1EC6EE542A29244158BAC10652A.description:
Identify nouns (regular, irregular, abstract), verbs (regular, irregular, simple tenses), adjectives, and/or adverbs within
sentences.

B9698619420B427397DDDCD576876552.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
a. Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.
b. Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.
c. Use abstract nouns (e.g., childhood).
d. Form and use regular and irregular verbs.
e. Form and use the simple verb tenses (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk).
f. Ensure subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.
g. Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.
h. Use coordinating and subordinating conjunctions.
i. Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.
j. Write one or more paragraphs that explain a main idea within a topic and support it with details and conclusions/closure.

B2C85F68ADB345B9BDD104F722780C0F.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

7C73DCA289EB44BBA387C8EEA93C3CFA.description:
Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See grade 3
Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

4989010A82E7487282D398AB5BF52C0B.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

698344BB621B49359A6725D969CA384B.description:
Create audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to
emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

50580BBB300A45279FE3CCDA935AAC26.description: Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

B3A88F785A0D401384091B54268511BB.description: Report on a topic, story or claim using a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts, and relevant and descriptive details.

5801C9A793434E92AA31D56F93AF4157.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an
understandable pace.

EFBFF73D327A494DBD57019BFAD62D15.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

03835DFA09BD41DAB79DF0D60F041819.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

5A8728EC82B848B68AC04A71BDB79480.description:
Identify supporting details of an informational text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including
visually, quantitatively, and orally.

6DFF5DB6E0C84129B8A80AE8C81325E3.description:
Determine the main idea of text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

4530FD12ADC143BCAF7B1D1555DF666D.description:
Determine the central message, lesson, moral, and key details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media
and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

11FC14A431104F00BEAE64BAC73D51FA.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

E4DDD9D08777406E822A18B0FE9BCB10.description: Express ideas and understanding in light of collaborative discussions.

6B038026E2A44ACA8D595940DF79D23D.description: Link personal ideas and comments to the ideas shared by others in collaborative discussions.

64B1D58A6D624D25B4BC9B3C89BE3AF1.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented in collaborative discussions.

8755DB1EB8714CF88A8B96B865A7F0FD.description: Provide evidence of being prepared for discussions on a topic, text, through appropriate statements made during discussion.

69B0659CE0FB46E3A9EB9B86BC693E1F.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and
texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known
about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time
about the topics and texts under discussion).
c. Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.
d. Explain their own ideas and understanding based on the discussion.

A790792C26354862909C1D535070BFBC.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

6ED2B3DC354A4383B14766F87EF82232.description:
Know and apply spelling conventions and patterns.
a. Spell single-syllable words with less common and complex graphemes (e.g., ough, augh, old, -ind, -ost, -ild families).
b. Identify language of origin for words, as noted in dictionaries.
c. Spell singular and plural possessives (e.g., teacher's, teachers').
d. Spell regular two-and three-syllable words that:
 1. Combine all basic syllable types: closed, VCe (Vowel-Consonant-silent e), open, vowel team, vowel-r, and consonant le.
 2. Include common, transparent prefixes and suffixes (e.g., re-, pre-, sub-, un-, dis-, mis-; -able, -ness, -ful, -tion).
e. Spell grade-level appropriate words in English, as found in a research-based list (*See guidelines under Word Lists in the ELA Glossary), including:
 1. Irregular words.
 2. Pattern-based words.

20240132D08D4E53BB8FD479AED584E0.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

DE85BB8E4A254F78B21B7B3AF22D7680.description:
Demonstrate and apply handwriting skills.
a. Read and write cursive letters, upper and lower case.
b. Transcribe ideas legibly in cursive and manuscript, with appropriate spacing and indentation.

1899FF9BAABB49BCAD2FD71B1ECE98BB.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

D7D43731D605440F95B551191DAAE293.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

F4BC47CD59C94A49954AA1B48708BB71.description: Take brief notes and categorize information(e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) from sources.

B248CD5280294A3D94A6CA6602EA0BCE.description: Sort evidence collected from print and/or digital sources into provided categories.

613377575DCA40609588FAFFB2146713.description: Sort evidence collected from print and/or digital sources into provided categories.

F10965D9D92E4757A9257CE7F3E9420A.description: Take brief notes (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) on sources.

62D25A953DFF46348C75940C99291B8D.description: Take brief notes (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) on sources.

18C282BE0CEE47B48D44EE53B506209E.description: Identify key details in an informational text.

1958270C76FC4A8E9F181331717B1D38.description: Locate important points on a single topic from two informational texts or sources.

BB18B1D381D54BAEBD4CB9F17E282417.description:
Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic with
the purpose of creating a permanent product (e.g., select/generate responses to form paragraph/essay).

568EBB5177E2425BAA82786FA7B6CD82.description:
Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote, or paraphrase from source) from text read aloud or information presented in diverse
media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

2E93230837B24A2FA47204EBB1979949.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight in text, quote, or paraphrase from text) from print and/or digital sources.

A63B9E5AC69E40F68CFF2112886BC6C8.description: Gather facts (e.g., highlight in text, quote, or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital sources.

FA291C31F28B43EABE59BDD820BAC214.description: Recall information from experiences for use in writing.

88E231A81BE648918339E48356E46F40.description: Recall relevant information from experiences for use in writing.

7DE98B0F08FC432388739A071129B54A.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into
provided categories.

52BE0080D2194CB38F899553318C7F55.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determine topic, locating information on a topic, organizing information
related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

8811B40C5AAE4853BCDA24717DBF136B.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

B81B21A09CBE482B8383506972682F07.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E9AA4D43B8854855ABC2E659897A9992.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use internet to gather information;
use word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

91DE616E815D4C9380D059A76EB16356.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and
collaborate with others.

6A4EBFE3A3A044DB81954153A1FCA063.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for clarity and meaning.

BE56F770FBF54FE994800359C5F2AEA1.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit narrative writing for clarity and meaning.

8E29050D47D74E3B988BE7317E9EC06A.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for clarity and meaning.

09B2793FD81E4C8794487C48879AC663.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising (e.g., review product, strengthening
argument).

399249ED3D014E6CB791A4A6143FA5C9.description:
With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task
and purpose (e.g., define purpose, which is to persuade, state your opinion, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a
meaningful conclusion).

8826A347AEAC4D9D93A911926226374C.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising.

B4F36AD1BEA94719927F3DD5FE9E7324.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising (e.g., review product, strengthening story).

6EBC9A172562427792C971CF5931D4ED.description:
With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task
and purpose (e.g., determine the topic, gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

8DBD35A0143144E1BA933C1C5F0F08B9.description:
With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task
and purpose (e.g., to introduce real or imagined experiences or events, elaborate on experiences or events with details and
techniques, provide a meaningful conclusion).

DCE969BF362D4A368AA60FECD8C0170A.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

940ECF0E8C9F401FBF79AB2E68207997.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing based on a literary topic (e.g., select a topic,
draft outline, develop narrative).

DCBC7F0CCA144C298870FD89138E71DB.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing.

015C03FCA6A74556A7E657EDA80C63F6.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for
conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 3.)

7EDAA84AFDB0449D89863A2E9995862F.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce a permanent product in which the development and organization are
appropriate to the task and purpose.

1EF1F69CB4FF425CA1AD3DD196FCCFD0.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task,
purpose (e.g., to entertain), and audience.

5290B76FB4C147339856C089BF0D11B6.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task
(e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), and audience (e.g., reader).

2BEA728E5BC24E47B5D97F19E0E65603.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.
(Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

79E291E41CDC4424BC2E6FE24A76C674.description:
Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph, or extended ending) that follows from the narrated experiences or
events.

7751B98620E74156AA03D024C1E0E6F5.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

73E5840B89574E72AB08D143EFFB7BAE.description: When appropriate, use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop a story.

C504F49DF2C148C1BC3109AB157600FF.description: Sequence events in writing that unfold naturally.

8FBB0CE021E4473298A13C21A7FCEB2D.description: Establish the situation by setting up the context for the story and introduce a narrator and/or characters.

27BBF5097E2948E7B96522C64DF8436B.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
a. Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.
b. Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to
situations.
c. Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.
d. Provide a sense of closure.

B6BB535B3ECB4748991CAEB2C08D4763.description: Provide a concluding statement or section to summarize the information presented.

EDAEA81C3DA442C5ABE2F3EFBB5F1674.description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

6A8D90A8B3A447EEA0B41664FEC66CAF.description: Include text features (e.g., numbers, labels, diagrams, charts, graphics) to enhance clarity and meaning.

CD111694B2D344109BE5C7C9A9DB13C1.description: Develop the topic (e.g., offer additional information which supports the topic) by using relevant facts, definitions, and details.

1C34D19CD9A34B318145B1C6F5E5A3CA.description: Introduce a topic and group related information together.

2B4A3B19B65C4DFA99B82DDB85AEA783.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
a. Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.
c. Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.
d. Provide a concluding statement or section.

EFF1721A5EB24BBCA26E7DE5A4CB2689.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

2A77A67740B940FAABDBD4308049350F.description: Use linking words and phrases that connect the opinions and reasons.

C141D40F67C34FAAA60DE6179A45FF40.description: Provide reasons or facts that support a stated opinion.

074ABBC712C54F399E51B15293C96A16.description: Introduce the topic or text within persuasive writing by stating an opinion.

6A114DAFD88A4C29B15D66FFDD274766.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, using reasons to support one's point of view.
a. Introduce the topic or text, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.
b. Provide reasons that support the opinion.
c. Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.
d. Provide a concluding statement or section.

438B8ED5CBA248EE89FF44744A825FAF.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

D9879B1FA06A4905AE08D646FD807D3E.description:
Practice self-monitoring strategies to aid comprehension (e.g., reread, use visuals or cueing system, self-correct, ask
questions, confirm predictions).

70BF20A9029B4C26AB874F816958C2B5.description: Identify grade level words with accuracy.

F92228F3FC43499E998CCB152F4B3428.description:
Read text (including prose and poetry) with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression (when applicable) on successive
readings.

C782D663AB88432382F7D46CF532022E.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
a. Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.
b. Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
c. Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

76BF8271DD274AA1AD19EEA86F2B8E99.description: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long vowels.

1F835C31E2DC49B9801DC9729A1EB11D.description: Decode regularly spelled one-syllable words with long vowels.

54C5D8D4B7874D1896EC8B2EDCDB1298.description: Recognize and/or read grade appropriate irregularly spelled words.

A1A56414CE854C9B86856FC858CFDBC1.description: Identify the meaning of most common suffixes.

8F45A96DE0FA4D258A5CB540040B6288.description: Identify the meaning of most common prefixes.

2CDE5DAF3BA249F6B5B6E3C5A2A062D7.description:
Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding one-syllable or multisyllabic words.
a. Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.
b. Decode words with common Latin suffixes.
c. Apply knowledge of the six syllable types to read grade-level words accurately.
d. Read grade-level appropriate irregularly spelled words.

4E8E344E9C9141A1A63B1DE0384FCE72.description: Read or be read to and recount self-selected stories, fables, folktales, myths, and other types of texts.

1A4F0398D5014FDFB5AB387C8B836CF5.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and
technical texts, in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 3.

575FE2EB0AF342C889C85B462DB1F613.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7AB33CE9B9364732AD9CCC12DDAF3BB1.description:
When researching a topic, compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two informational
texts on the same topic.

8802C63B2EB643E9B7050891AC2E8EB6.description: Compare two or more texts on the same topic or by the same author.

3EF4FDC8A2234D999BE49A7C33FAC13A.description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

1080ACF1832E4AC3945AA403E4BB9A03.description: Describe the connection between sentences and paragraphs in a text.

8FDCB898C17645729FE36C4DE762D8DE.description: Identify signal words that help determine what the text structure is in an informational text.

B0DDA3F9CDDF4F62B08992561160EA62.description:
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a
sequence).

0FE2554CD554403F9F895BD8433D752D.description:
Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of
the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).
3.RI.i3 Within informational texts, locate or identify evidence in the text or graphics to support the central ideas.

3ED410D554F2460B814958DFB73EA1BE.description: Identify information learned from illustrations and information learned from the words in an informational text.

B04B682BB0CF401AA3283DC17FED34A4.description: Use illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) in informational texts to answer questions.

F9CDFF192AEA44109AD7515ACF047051.description:
Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g.,
where, when, why, and how key events occur).

04D0E326FA874D26B69F17C75FD1C8E0.description: Compare own point of view to that of the author.

858503D586604BA8ADAC4AAAE114BB1C.description: Identify own point of view about a topic.

BF870864783B4A4B942815043E056191.description: Identify the author's purpose in an informational text.

06531F28377645B48395AD10C86D93F9.description: Distinguish one's own point of view from that of the author of a text.

BC87FF3110844A9BA8B5C2279820AB4A.description: Use tools (e.g., sidebars, icons, glossary) to locate information relevant to a given topic.

46E5EDF3400D482580C5A475561F7F76.description: Use text features (keywords, glossary) to locate information relevant to a given topic or question.

509AE785D2C64ED0B26C65E697D75F5E.description: Identify the purpose of a variety of text features.

EEC22A1EE40C4D99A1DB7EA70E74647E.description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

4C051BF34D784B0790DCFC7ED3AEF90B.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or
subject area.

690B612170B649FA89268D63B5B7EA53.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

A406C275A3BC47448DB7CE5B4801C509.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

F8197597F2FF4336AD8B31A70AD798F4.description:
Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using
language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

B088C4B6D0594F15A54CD0E3A548E7CD.description: Identify facts that an author uses to support a specific point or opinion.

513E2D45FAF940288F6ED8B508BCCCAF.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

F7D1093926DA40C5958D746E9FD0B451.description:
Determine the main idea of text, read aloud, or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

266518E10654424BACF14D3048300D6A.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount and paraphrase the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

134D9DDAEE244048BC08B7DF2D641950.description:
Identify supporting details of an informational text read, read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats,
including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

AC668A6F080F4A9D90E364724DE2ECF6.description: Answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

45F0FD502BB1498D965FB0E9E26BB5C0.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

13F3BE52BE034107AC6ABD8D561D1ABD.description: Read or be read to and recount self-selected stories, fables, folktales, myths, and other types of texts or adapted text.

14818743E22F49F39313E420D4E8D3B1.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 3.

300177381C3A495B973A3571073995A8.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

14CAAB7AFA0A404EB86B72FA7E2BDC8A.description: Compare two or more texts or adapted texts on the same topic or by the same author.

DCBCB5AA932947F7BCB2F1AE3658AC3D.description:
Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books
from a series).

687A22D07D7948E3B72A6E02B0F59CCA.description: Use descriptive words and illustrations/visuals from a story, read or viewed, to explain the mood in a given part of the story.

CD9A10B3B6CB47BB9B80E655DFCBF312.description: Support inferences, opinions, and conclusions using evidence from the text including illustrations.

9294D903A7464C99A64D6D0E51BC00D9.description:
Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize
aspects of a character or setting).

8E4064CDCE8B4A69AC007799E5A2C037.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

B5B787831C3342ADA1ED72597BA1FD37.description: Identify narrator or character's point of view.

C5D4E3BDB67A482CB39F99E7C7D08653.description: Distinguish one's own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

EF0D9C08B1CD4A8D985136443C0C1E6D.description:
Identify how the structure of a play is different than the structure of a story (e.g., text includes props; dialogue without
quotation marks acts/scenes instead of chapter).

01AD3EEE8EE24F20A2288F91D0715E8D.description: Identify how the structure of a poem is different than a story (e.g., rhyme shorter than stories; stanza instead of paragraph).

64F0057B5E6F41D5B5A72B7D28A5F5B6.description:
Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe
how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

F88AA524E2BB4ECF8E13631B1981D807.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or
subject area.

B1496AA5FEE445DCBFD3ADCAB68E2EDE.description: Determine the meaning of literal and nonliteral words and phrases as they are used in a text.

CE253E84DA6941C79E1CF844C854D4F6.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

3FE327B7559541B4AE8205E85655D17D.description: Analyze how a character's point of view influences a conflict within a text.

3A8588A3A6EC4EA7B3BF7A47C58074F3.description: Describe how a character changed in a story (e.g., different words, thoughts, feelings, actions).

2063DA0921474A2E8ACC1483ECDEB342.description: Explain a character's feelings in a story using the character's thoughts, words, and actions as evidence from the text.

41687BB854F44FFF8157F95ABE9DFFD3.description: Explain a character's motivation in a story using the character's thoughts, words, and actions as evidence from the text.

D22725B25EDB4B2F8944D743A4209198.description: Describe a character's traits in a story using details from the text and illustrations.

D1278F28AC2740128EFA0C84AD267750.description: Explain how characters' actions contribute to the sequence of events/plot.

5DDC78D91DC94A6DB94409A85BF966A3.description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

2912559E80DF46119332F896C1DD4DCA.description: Use information in the text to determine and explain a lesson learned by a character or theme within the story.

1F4FE1251973412D81548F098A853DC9.description: Use details to recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures.

D6603005480F4358A2B0C60F87FF553F.description: Identify the central message (theme), lesson, or moral within a story, folktale, or fable from diverse cultures.

D0F50AE069F34709ABB182356C7403C9.description:
Recount and paraphrase stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral
and explain how it is conveyed through key details in text.

AB2F9675AE5149D9AF8A21285F946E23.description: Support inferences, opinions, and conclusions using evidence from the text including illustrations.

D29D94E2CC3A495D8CF1060C703A75C7.description: Answer questions (literal and inferential) and refer to text to support your answer.

D166ACE7B4784ECB9DEADEA398198B8E.description:
Answer questions related to the relationship between characters, setting, events, or conflicts (e.g., characters and events,
characters and conflicts, setting and conflicts).

23E5ED3C00B947CB89AB3E4DA0B2DE7C.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
